page.title: 06LEOMINSTER FESTIVAL
page.content: For many years the Birmingham Philharmonic Orchestra has visitied the Prioy during June. It was the idea of Vernon Thurgood,organist and choirmaster to build a Festival around this event. The first was held in 1980 and is biannual. There is a varied programme to cater for the interests of the whole town. As well as famous names like Julian Lloyd Webber there have been jazz groups, comedians, ballet and Street Theatre. There is local talent too and a combined schools' concert. Festival '86 is well underway with many plans for an exciting and stimulaling two weeks in{ {Leominster. {
